senses.de: A place where products are sold, such as a store or shop.
senses.ex: I bought this dress at an outlet mall.

Tips.title: Discount Shopping
Tips.description: An outlet mall usually offers products at lower prices compared to regular stores.
Tips.example: You might find good deals on branded items at the outlet mall.

Tips.title: Factory Products
Tips.description: 'Factory outlet' means products come directly from the manufacturer, often cheaper.
Tips.example: He bought his kitchenware from a factory outlet.

Tips.title: Location-Specific
Tips.description: Use 'outlet' when referring to a physical store, not an online retailer.
Tips.example: Is there an outlet store nearby where I can try these shoes?

senses.de: A point from which something, especially gas or liquid, can escape.
senses.ex: The pipe has an outlet to drain excess water.

Tips.title: Flow Escape
Tips.description: This 'outlet' refers to places where fluid or gas can leave a system.
Tips.example: Make sure the water outlet is clear to avoid flooding.

Tips.title: Equipment Part
Tips.description: In machinery, 'outlet' can refer to a component where output occurs.
Tips.example: The technician checked the air conditioner's outlet for blockages.

senses.de: A device in a wall that you put a plug into in order to connect electrical equipment to the power supply.
senses.ex: Plug the laptop charger into the electrical outlet.

Tips.title: Electrical Connection
Tips.description: An electrical 'outlet' is for plugging in devices to use electricity.
Tips.example: She searched for an electrical outlet to charge her phone.

Tips.title: Safety First
Tips.description: Always ensure your hands are dry before using an electrical outlet.
Tips.example: He dried his hands before plugging the iron into the outlet.

Tips.title: Voltage Matters
Tips.description: Outlets can differ in shape and voltage internationally; adaptors may be needed.
Tips.example: Traveling abroad, she needed an adaptor for the different power outlets.

senses.de: A means of expressing one's talents, energy, or emotions.
senses.ex: Art can be a great outlet for stress and anxiety.

Tips.title: Expression Avenue
Tips.description: Use 'outlet' for describing ways of expressing emotions or creativity.
Tips.example: Painting is a healthy outlet for his energy.

Tips.title: Stress Relief
Tips.description: 'Outlet' can suggest a release from mental or emotional strain.
Tips.example: Running provides an outlet for her daily stress.

Distribute.wordDefinition:
Distribute means to give out or spread something among a group of people or places.

It is often used in the context of goods or products being distributed among various stores or locations.

Distribute refers to the process of getting goods to different outlets or stores, while outlet is the point where a customer can purchase the product.

Distribute is about getting the product to the outlet while outlet is where customers can buy the product.

Market.wordDefinition:
A market is a place where goods or services are sold, usually outdoors or in a large indoor space.

A market is like a large gathering of sellers and buyers, while an outlet is a retail store that sells discounted products from a specific brand or retail chain.

Retailer.wordDefinition:
A retailer is a general term for any store that sells products to consumers.

Retailers can sell products from a variety of brands and sources, and their prices may or may not be discounted.

A retailer such as Macy's sells many different brands of clothing, including Nike, and their prices may not be discounted.

An outlet is a store that sells discounted products directly from the manufacturer, while a retailer sells products from a variety of brands at regular or discount prices.

Showroom.wordDefinition:
A showroom is a retail store where new or current products are displayed to attract customers.

A showroom is located in an upscale location and is designed to attract more customers to buy products at full price.

Showrooms are also a place where customers can try products before purchasing.

An outlet is a store that sells products at discounted prices, while a showroom is a store that showcases new or current products at full prices.

Store.wordDefinition:
A store is a retail location that sells current or new merchandise at regular prices.

Outlet stores are usually located away from city centers and in malls or shopping centers specifically designed for outlet shopping.

The merchandise sold at an outlet store may be overstock, out-of-season, or factory seconds. Outlet stores often carry a variety of brands under one roof.

Regular stores are usually located in city centers or shopping malls and carry current or new merchandise at regular prices.

These stores may offer sales or discounts, but not to the extent of an outlet store. They may also have a wider variety of products and name brands.

An outlet is a store that sells discounted or older merchandise, while a store sells new or current merchandise at regular prices.

Storefront.wordDefinition:
A storefront is a physical location where a business operates and sells its products or services directly to the customers.

It is a retail location that may or may not offer discounted prices. Outlet are usually located in outlet malls, while storefronts can be located in any commercial area.

Vendor.wordDefinition:
A vendor is an individual or a company that sells products or services to customers at a retail level.

A vendor could be a small business owner selling products from different manufacturers or a street vendor selling handmade products.

For example, a hot dog vendor sells hot dogs on the street, and does not necessarily sell specific branded goods.

An outlet is a store which is directly owned or managed by the brand or manufacturer selling its products, while a vendor is a merchant who sells products from various manufacturers.

quotes.Text: Mentors provide professional networks, outlets for frustration, college and career counseling, general life advice, and most importantly, an extra voice telling a student they are smart enough and capable enough to cross the stage at graduation and land their first paycheck from a career pathway job.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Gerald Chertavian

quotes.Text: The truth is that I didn't start out making commercial movies. My films were not film festival movies with the possible exception slightly of 'Super,' but I was able to nurture my gifts through the works of artists making lower budget films that needed a place and an outlet.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: James Gunn

quotes.Text: In a perfect world, I would be a painter. I love working with my hands. I don't get to do it as much as I like, but I am finding a way to make more time as life goes on because it's a really great outlet for me to express myself.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Halle Berry

quotes.Text: My mom has always said that the one thing she wishes she had done differently is have a job. She felt like the single-mindedness made her a little nuts sometimes, and she could have used an outlet for herself when we were little.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Jennifer Garner

quotes.Text: Acting is such a huge part of my life. It really allows me to have a creative outlet and to actually be able to have an outlet to discuss openly the things that truly I think are relevant in the world, that make a difference.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Ian Somerhalder

quotes.Text: The best thing about acting is that I get to lose myself in another character and actually get paid for it... It's a great outlet. I'm not really sure who I am - it seems I change every day.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Leonardo DiCaprio

quotes.Text: I've always felt more comfortable in fantasy. Fantasy has felt more real to me at times. Drawing was an immediate outlet for that: to create. It's been my ability to create my own world.
quotes.Title: American Artist
quotes.Name: Frances Bean Cobain

quotes.Text: I just had a crazy, wild imagination all my life, and science fiction is the greatest outlet for me.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Steven Spielberg

quotes.Text: I've been painting all my life, and I'm serious about it. I use it as more or less an outlet.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Yvette Mimieux

quotes.Text: People are trying to find an outlet to tell their truth.
quotes.Title: American Activist
quotes.Name: Tarana Burke
